tweet: The ESCAPE Act would put an end to these nightmare scenarios and ensure that communities have strong and efficient evacuation routes.

In 2017, residents of Yuba County and neighboring communities were subjected to hours of bumper-to-bumper traffic on a narrow two-lane highway as they attempted to evacuate from a near catastrophic failure of the Oroville Dam's emergency spillway.

THREAD: Thank you to the Yuba County Board of Supervisors for formally supporting my bill, the ESCAPE Act, which would help communities build new or improve existing escape routes that are vital for mass evacuations during emergencies. pic.twitter.com/GELfITwmv5

American shipyards and mariners should not be expected to compete against heavily subsidized foreign shipyards in Korea, China, and elsewhere and this bill ensures that they will not have to. 

See my press release below: https://garamendi.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-john-garamendi-and-senator-roger-wicker-reintroduce-energizing …

Today, @SenatorWicker and I reintroduced the “Energizing American Shipbuilding Act.” This bipartisan legislation pushes my Make It In America agenda by bringing jobs back to American shipyards and expands our nation’s sealift capacity, making our country safer and stronger.
Thank you to the Mare Island Dry Dock and the Carpenters Union Local 180 for meeting with me and allowing me to tour their sites.
I also stopped by Carpenters Union Local 180 to tour their facilities and discuss my support for vocational training and the building trades through my work in Congress.

I had an excellent meeting at Mare Island to tour the site and discuss my new legislation, the “Energizing American Shipbuilding Act” that would provide a vital stimulus to shipyards like Mare Island by creating new U.S.-flagged ships.

Today I hosted meetings in my district to advance my Make It In America agenda. We can create thousands of new middle-class jobs by rebuilding our nation’s crumbling infrastructure with American materials & workers, & that’s what my Make It In America agenda would accomplish pic.twitter.com/01akyRvsMZ

This week, I joined fellow @HouseDemocrats in passing the #RaisetheWage Act. This legislation raises the minimum wage incrementally to $15 by 2025, gives up to 33 million Americans a raise, and lifts at least 1.3 million Americans out of poverty. pic.twitter.com/ItF8u3DqKB

I was honored to receive the California Retired Teachers Association's Friend of CalRTA award today. As a proud father of public school teachers, I understand the need for robust funding for education. pic.twitter.com/hn8RVGClS3
My words in 2016 still hold true today: the children are listening and the message that our president is conveying is unacceptable.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rIIGL3lQ4wM … I have been saying this since day one: our President is a bully. President Trump’s racist, xenophobic and bigoted rhetoric has undeniable ripple effects. I just cosponsored a resolution condemning the President's openly racist remarks against my colleagues in the House. We cannot tolerate racist, xenophobic and bigoted remarks anywhere in our country, especially not in the White House.

Once again the President has shown his true colors as an unapologetic bigot. His language is outrageous. This bill reverses all cuts in compensation that first responders and their families have experienced and ensures that their annual gross income is adjusted periodically based on inflation. It is time that these heroic first responders and their families get the care they deserve

This bill is named after 9/11 first responders James Zadroga, Ray Pfeifer, and Luis Alvarez, who passed away from 9/11-related illnesses. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/12/us/politics/9-11-first-responders-fund.html …

Today, I voted to pass H.R. 1327, the “Never Forget the Heroes: James Zadroga, Ray Pfeifer, and Luis Alvarez Permanent Authorization of the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund Act.”  https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/12/us/politics/9-11-first-responders-fund.html …

Today I voted to pass an amendment to prohibit the use of unauthorized military force in or against Iran. This amendment passed with bipartisan support, sending a message to the President that he cannot force us into an unconstitutional war with Iran.
